contentrichtext.text: {{redirect|Electric lamp|the item of furniture|light fixture}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Lelightbulbs.jpg|160px|thumb|Various compact fluorescent (CFL) lightbulbs.]] [[File:Gluehlampe 01 KMJ.jpg|160px|thumb|A clear glass 60W Neolux light bulb.]] A '''lamp''' is a replaceable component such as an [[incandescent light bulb]], which is designed to produce [[light]] from [[electricity]]. These components usually have a base of ceramic, metal, glass or plastic, which makes an electrical connection in the socket of a [[light fixture]]. This connection may be made with a screw-thread base, two metal pins, two metal caps or a bayonet cap. '''Re-lamping''' is the replacement of only the removable lamp in a light fixture. ==Lamp circuit symbols== In [[circuit diagram]]s lamps usually are shown as symbols. There are two main types of symbols, these are: {{Gallery |lines=4 |File:Lamp symbol.svg|The cross in a circle, which usually represents a lamp as an indicator. |File:Lamp symbol, old.svg|The semicircular dent in a circle, which usually represents a lamp as a source of light or illumination. }} {{Artificial light sources}} [[Category:Lighting]] [[Category:Lamps| ]] [[Category:Electrical components]] [[Category:Glass applications]]
